channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump files $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times
item.description: President Donald Trump filed a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times and four of its journalists on Monday, according to court doc...

item.title: JD Vance vows to carry on Kirk's legacy. And, the Fed meets to decide interest rates.
item.description: Vice President Vance hosted Charlie Kirk's podcast yesterday and vowed to carry on his friend's political legacy. And, the Federal Reserve meets to de...

item.title: On 9/16/25, celebrate a date of mathematical beauty
item.description: Pythagorean Triple Square Day, as one man affectionately calls 9/16/25, is a day like no other this century.

item.title: On Texas border, uninsured people stress the health system. It's set to get worse
item.description: In South Texas' Rio Grande Valley, many people go without health insurance, and the health system struggles as a result. Similar communities dot the n...

item.title: Is telehealth a good idea, or should I see my regular doctor?
item.description: Social media is full of their colorful ads, but are online doctors legit? Here's the lowdown on the pros and cons of online medicine.

item.title: Justin Bieber and Sabrina Carpenter to headline Coachella 2026
item.description: Karol G will also top the bill at the festival held in the Californian desert.

item.title: 9/15: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Suspect in Charlie Kirk shooting is not cooperating, Utah governor says; Oklahoma City’s GOP mayor makes the case for diversity.

item.title: Will the Fed cut rates this week? These charts may determine its decision.
item.description: With the U.S. economy facing headwinds, the Federal Reserve faces pressure to trim interest rates this week for the first time since December 2024.

item.title: Google owner reveals £5bn AI investment in UK ahead of Trump visit
item.description: Google's president and chief investment officer Ruth Porat tells the BBC there are "profound opportunities in the UK".

item.title: A father nearly died by an assailant’s bullet. He’s one of many crime victims US wants to deport
Israel's military says Gaza City ground offensive is underway
item.description: Israel's military says troops have "begun pushing into the heart of Gaza City," renewing its call for thousands of war-weary civilians to evacuate.

item.title: Kenya issues arrest warrant for British national over young mother's murder
item.description: The 21-year-old was killed in 2012 and her body found in a septic tank in the garrison town of Nanyuki.

item.title: Artefacts recovered from Titanic's sunk sister ship
item.description: Items retrieved from the wreck of HMHS Britannic in the Aegean include a bell and binoculars, Greece says.

item.title: Color mystery in famous Jackson Pollock painting finally solved
item.description: Scientists have identified the origins of the blue color in one of Jackson Pollock's paintings with a little help from chemistry.

item.title: Trump sues New York Times for $15 billion for alleged "defamation and libel"
item.description: President Trump is suing The New York Times for $15 billion for what he says is a years-long pattern of defamation and libel by the paper against him.

item.title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, UN commission of inquiry says
item.description: The panel finds that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out against Palestinians during the war.

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk shooting likely to face charges Tuesday before first court hearing
item.description: Prosecutors are looking at filing a capital murder charge against the Utah man jailed in the killing of prominent conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Trump administration joins Republicans’ campaign to police speech in reaction to Kirk’s killing
